newsitem.title: PANAMA: Haiti says Cedras still a destabilizing factor.
newsitem.headline: Haiti says Cedras still a destabilizing factor.

text.p: Former Haitian military ruler Gen. Raul Cedras and his chief of staff Phillipe Biamby continue to destabilise Haiti from exile in Panama, a leading Haitian politician said on Friday.

The two men "are taking advantage of their (exile) status in Panama to continue destabilising Haiti," Jean Gabriel Fortune, president of the Haitian parliament's Foreign Affairs Commission, told a news conference during an official visit.
Cedras and Biamby left for Panama in a U.S. military plane when Haiti's military regime collapsed after the arrival of U.S. troops in 1994 to restore ousted President Jean-Bertrand Aristide.
Fortune said the two "should be returned to Haiti for trial."
The Haitian government recently issued arrest warrants for Biamby and Cedras' wife Yannick, who live in exile in a wealthy neighbourhood of Panama City. They are wanted on charges of corruption.
Fortune said Haiti would probably seek to extradite the former leaders and their families, but he noted that Panama and Haiti do not share an extradition treaty.
